A: 1. What is the capital of France (a) Berlin (b) Rome (c) Paris
2. Which planet is known as the Red Planet (a) Jupiter (b) Mars (c) Venus
3. The largest ocean on Earth is the _ Ocean (a) Atlantic (b) Indian (c) Pacific
4. How many continents are there in the world (a) 5 (b) 6 (c) 7
5. What is the chemical symbol for water (a) O2 (b) H2O (c) CO2
6. Who painted the Mona Lisa (a) Vincent van Gogh (b) Pablo Picasso (c) Leonardo da Vinci
7. The Great Wall of China is located in which country (a) India (b) Japan (c) China
8. Which animal is known as the 'King of the Jungle' (a) Tiger (b) Lion (c) Elephant
9. A baby cat is called a _ (a) puppy (b) kitten (c) cub
10. Which organ pumps blood throughout the body (a) Lungs (b) Brain (c) Heart
11. How many days are in a leap year (a) 365 (b) 366 (c) 364
12. What is the main gas that makes up the Earth's atmosphere (a) Oxygen (b) Carbon Dioxide (c) Nitrogen
13. Which of these is a primary color (a) Green (b) Orange (c) Blue
14. The process by which plants make their own food is called _ (a) Respiration (b) Photosynthesis (c) Digestion
15. Which season comes after spring (a) Autumn (b) Winter (c) Summer
16. How many legs does a spider have (a) 6 (b) 8 (c) 10
17. The fastest land animal is the _ (a) Lion (b) Cheetah (c) Gazelle
18. What is the freezing point of water in Celsius (a) 100 (b) 0 (c) -10
19. Which famous scientist developed the theory of relativity (a) Isaac Newton (b) Albert Einstein (c) Stephen Hawking
20. The largest desert in the world is the _ Desert (a) Sahara (b) Arabian (c) Gobi
